text: this is the conference center in garland
in Texas where an anti-islamic art
competition was being held the contest
involved cartoons of the Prophet
Muhammad shortly before seven p.m. local
time two men drove up to the center and
began shooting at a security officer
police then shot the suspected gunman
dead at the scene inside a police
officer reportedly told those attending
that there had been a shooting up there
please the problem area we're concerned
about is right where all y'all parked
your cars so we cannot get to your
vehicle's those in the center were then
taken to another building and nearby
businesses were also evacuated as a
precaution started hearing it sounded
kind of like a machine gun may be kind
of quick shots police started running
everywhere and so they quickly told us
to run as fast as we could to get back
in the building first reaction was
concern for the policeman I have we have
just heard that he was taken to the
hospital and I'm very glad to hear that
he's still alive in a statement the
authorities later confirmed that the
security officer who'd been shot was
injured but those injuries were not
life-threatening but police were
concerned the gunman's car could contain
an explosive device and the bomb squad
was called to the scene the event was a
controversial one depictions of the
Prophet Muhammad a seen as blasphemous
we prepared for something like like this
simply because there were additional
officers that were hired for this event
by the school district we had talked
with them in preparing for this event in
case something like this happened among
those attending the far-right Dutch
politician Geert builders in a tweet he
said he'd just left the building after
giving a speech after the shooting
police also turned to social media
asking people to avoid the area then
bland BBC News
